description: Daria Tomenko, after weighing the risk of total surveillance, secretly rewrites the firmware patch. She introduces a covert channel into the update, enabling erased 'ghost' citizens to mask their presence and navigate BCI checkpoints undetected.

Shortly after the patch deployment, system operators notice irregular signals in citizen logs. Suspicious activity clusters around locations linked to old erasure zones, triggering quiet alarms among observant supervisors.

Anonymous messages flood local networks, outlining safe routes, supply drops, and tips to undermine BCI sensors. The phrase 'Every erasure leaves a shadow' becomes a symbol of the newly empowered resistance.

A coordinated blackout sweeps through restored neighborhoods. Residents report power failures and BCI checkpoint disruptions. Ordinary citizens begin discreetly helping the 'ghosts' evade detection as rumors of sabotage spread.

Unable to contain the invisible resistance, restored officials declare a state of emergency. Protests break out as 'ghost' networks mobilize openly, demanding recognition and systemic reform, deepening the crisis across Stenograd.
